website_summaries.verdict: The Pogoplug Series 4 is a cleverly simple device for getting files and media from your hard drive, USB drive, or SD card online and making them shareable with smartphones, tablets, and PCs. While many may find it redundant with cloud storage services, the Series 4 is easily the best version of the Pogoplug to date.
pros: The Pogoplug Series 4 is an adapter that lets you access any 2.5-inch hard drive, USB storage device, or SD card from anywhere online
It's easy to set up, attractively small, and smartly designed
Files can be accessed via browser or apps, and automatic backup of photos and videos from a phone or iPad using the Pogoplug app works surprisingly well, too
cons: Video playback on a TV is still a weird and kludgy experience, and video formats don't all work perfectly
automated file backup isn't as smooth and transparent as on an Apple Time Capsule or other NAS device
USB 3 flash drives got extremely hot when plugged in

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware – NO support
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Pogoplug devices (series 4 and mobile), both on paid subscription. For the past month, both devices have shown offline. Can’t get these up and running no matter what. Support is nonexistent. Absolutely no phone number to call. You can only submit tickets online. And the tickets I’m submitting online are automatically being closed. You get an email with a link to their QA section which is absolutely worthless. Now out 2 paid subscriptions for the year and cannot get these devices to work anymore. They have completely abandoned their products, service and customers.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. There is no support for this product beyond their knowledge base. The downloads page which claims to host a number of potentially useful applications only works for the products that tie you into their subscription services. If you attempt to raise a ticket via email or through the web page, tickets are closed automatically with a message to simply look at the knowledge base. Yes, set up was fast and the basic functionality appears to do what they claim although transfer speeds locally are painfully slow via the web front end. Be aware though, if you encounter any kind of issue, you're on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Skinny

customer_reviews.title: The product works but not what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something closer to a nas(network attached storage).My router supports only up to 2tb.I bought a 4tb external to replace a full 2tb external usb.This showed both drives,but unfortunately video had to be downloaded to my pc before viewing even though the drives were on my network.I thought I could stream directly from this.I did read that you could portforward this and it could work,but I didn't feel like schooling myself on yet another procedure to get something to do what I want it to do.Wish this could have worked for me.I give it 5 stars because it did see all I hooked up to it,customer service allowed me to rma it and for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not supported and no longer active
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as an external drive access point. The technology requires you to connect to servers on the internet to leverage the functionality. The company is no longer in existence!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andre B

customer_reviews.title: Great little device for the cost!
customer_reviews.text: This works great to backup files on our network without having a dedicated PC running. Super simple to setup. I currently use it with two laptops and two iphones without a problem. I know it can do more advanced things (sending out secure links so I can share directly from the drive to others via email or Facebook), but I don't see a need for that. We mostly use it to backup photos of the kids, documents, and things like that. Overall, very happy with the device and interface. And there is quite a bit of room for expansion (multiple ports for drives). I imagine I will use this for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K

customer_reviews.title: Great embedded Linux device.
customer_reviews.text: Great little platform to run archlinuxarm. I use it to run Infinitude ( to control my network thermostat. It sits on top of my air handler and talks to the thermostat over the network,to my other HVAC devices through an RS485 USB dongle, and to 1-wire sensors with another USB dongle. The Pogoplug is a lot like a Raspberry Pi, but with a case and a gigabit ethernet(and cheaper). Highly recommended if you need a small low-power linux device to tuck in a corner somewhere and forget about.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lifsey

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! No matter how cheap they price it. Waste of your money
customer_reviews.text: Worst piece of junk! Will not detect drives. The only thing worse than this piece of crud, is the the non-existent tech support. I asked a question several times even stating the solution was not there and got an auto-reply within seconds redirecting me to their support page. DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: UNIT RETURNED BECAUSE POGOPLUS STOPPED SUPPORTING NO-CHARGE SERVICE.
customer_reviews.text: Product manufacturer, PogoPlug, after several years, recently (June 2016?) stopped supporting services it offered at no-charge. To use this product, I would have had to pay $30 PER YEAR for each computer used to access the PogoPlug network. No. Thank. You. Product was returned and I received a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: EeeVee

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive way to back up your files
customer_reviews.text: First, customer support is GREAT. They answered EVERY single question I had within usually 24 hours, maybe 48 at the most. Unit functions as said. My major frustration was one day their servers went down and even though I do NOT use the cloud with them, the unit didn't work. I was under the assumptions this was MY network I was using. I spent over an hour and half tying to fix it, and left an email to Pogoplug. They were VERY VERY sorry and said it was at their end and would be fixed shortly. It was. HOPE that doesn't happen to often. If that didn't happen, I would have given a 5 star rating
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Innovation solely to make money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, because it was the "NEW" and "Latest" version. Turns out to be the exact same one I was already disenchanted with.When Pogoplug first came out, you could share the contents of the connected hard drive with anybody to who you gave your info. Now they tout added cost programs so that your family can access this same hard drive. The back up program is slow to the point of being pointless. I bought a 3.0 USB hard drive thinking that this would be faster than the 2.0. Wrong! The company has evolved from providing your own cloud to wanting to provide and charge for their cloud. It is a a rain cloud as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Bevitz

customer_reviews.title: Customer support is the real winner
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool concept. I used it with an old USB external HD I have and it works really well. The setup, for me, wasn't as easy as I'd hope and required contacting support to have them add some IP addresses to my account to be able to view the HD remotely from my iPhone. However, these requests were sent to pogo plug on a Sunday and responded to in less than an hour. The real winner here is the Pogo Plug support team and because of that have created a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: No native SMB support, very slow
customer_reviews.text: For all of those looking to make a cheap NAS with SMB out of it, don't bother. Yes, it is possible, but the speeds are so slow it is not worth your time. Here are all the speeds you will get with it when it is connected via gigabit ethernet and gigibit internet connection: Using pogoplug software: 1MB/s up, 2MB/s down Using ssh to make a samba: 1MB/s up, 1.5MB/s down it had so much potential, very dissapointing. If you want to build a real NAS you might as well go with an entry level NAS from netgear or something.
customer_reviews.author: Willard

customer_reviews.title: It works somewhat!
customer_reviews.text: Not a true NAS but will do the job as long as software is installed on all computers. Only device of this type and price range that I found that had USB 3.0 built in. Works reliably for keeping data with a variety of different software. The media streaming option is another story. It works but takes a long time. I was not able to use this reliably on my smart phone when away from my home computer. A professional online cloud storage provider is a better option (IF YOU WANT TO PAY FOR THE SERVICES). You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: killer cal

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all I don't know why Amazon even allows it to be sold.
customer_reviews.text: Parent company either out of business or no longer supporting this device. It shouldn't be sold at all on Amazon, what a waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Critical_Bill

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: I have a previous version of this device, and just as with some reviews on this device, I too can no longer use the device. It appears that the Pogoplug service is either temporarily (or permanently) shut down, making my Pogoplug a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: Pogoplug wasn't quite what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: The device was a snap to set up but I should have paid more attention to how I wanted it set up. I have a 3TB external drive that I already use for backups but if you don't get a sata drive that plugs into the top of the Pogoplug you will have to plug and unplug an external drive. If you have or purchase a sata drive that plugs into the top of the Pogoplug you don't have to do the plug/unplug routine. They could have been a little more clearer on that part of the instructions. I will be purchasing a sata drive soon as I think it is too much of a hassle the other way.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Lose

customer_reviews.title: It's great..
customer_reviews.text: and even better if you hack it. I bought two. I keep one in the default pogo mode and use it like a regular pogo plug. It's slow, but it works and I love it. BUT, when it went on sale, I picked up a second one, and hacked that one to be an FTP server... effectively bypassing the pogo servers. It's FAST and awesome. I can share LARGE files with friends and access my files while on the road or on other devices. LOVE THIS THING! I wish I needed another one so I could buy another one. haha.
customer_reviews.author: B. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Your personal Cloud storage for pennies
customer_reviews.text: Your personal Cloud storage for pennies I do not know why did it not become popular, the heading of the product is confusing, it is your one time $18 for your own personal cloud storage that you can access anywhere. Just Hook up a RAID-1 usb drive to it to ensure you are extra safe, as with Raid-1 the data is duplicated to two Hard drives so just in case one dies you are safe, and have ample of time to replace the dead one
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: I cloud for the home.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of technology. Plugs into the modem. Then all you do is plug a 3 or 4 terabyte hard drive into the pogo plug and wow instant I cloud. All you have to do now is download the app. unto your device, laptop, phone, ipad etc. Allows you to store data from anywhere to the pogo plug or retrieve the same data from the pogo plug from any device from anywhere. You can also give a key to anyone that you trust to access this data.
customer_reviews.author: goatbear2

customer_reviews.title: It still works  OpenWRT Samba server
customer_reviews.text: Did my thing and investigated installing ALARM and followed Qui's techNOLOGY Blog, to get Plex running.. It's terribly slow, at Plex but it was fun learning some tricks and made for some great downtime fun. Update 2/6/2020 This thing is Rock solid not as intended but with Arch Linux open wrt and makes pretty good media server upgrade hard drive to a 2TB firecuda just recently. That last one on Amazon looking mighty tasty at $29.
customer_reviews.author: Off The Beaten Path

customer_reviews.title: Poor capability & poor documentation.
customer_reviews.text: Product data says it works with any USB drive. However it does not work with WD My Passport drives or Seagate GoFlex drives. I could find nothing online to indicate which drives it was really compatible with. I suspect it has insufficient power to run a hard drive through thew USB ports but have no data confirming this. I would definitely NOT recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: DAS

customer_reviews.title: Arch Linux runs great on it
customer_reviews.text: Great little device. I installed Arch Linux on it and have a 3TB drive attached that I use to backup several computers and devices on my local network. The only downside is I'm also a CrashPlan user and getting CrashPlan running on this small of a footprint is difficult and I eventually gave up. Instead, I just remotely mount the storage from the Pogoplug to my Mac Mini and then I CrashPlan back it up through there, so I have both on-site and off-site backups.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, if it only worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Where do I begin, there's so many issues with this device that it's extremely frustrating. The iphone app eventually stops working, the drive disappears. The USB 3.0 ports don't even work and they're aware of this issue going on 2 years and it's yet to be rectified. If you need support, it's only via email and go on vacation because that's how long it takes to get a response. I owned their first device and it worked great but it seems their newer devices aren't up to par. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Forget it
customer_reviews.text: Out of business. No way to access some features now that I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Puncsak

customer_reviews.title: Dont Wast Your Money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and thought it would be the answer to my backup sharing of files. BUT it seems the company has gone out of business and there is no App or home page on the Web to set it up or get it going. So Dont Wast Your Money.
customer_reviews.author: azlee

customer_reviews.title: Added another to my network, just understand the devices limitations...
customer_reviews.text: Found a good deal, and decided to add another to my network, I mostly use it as a place to host my backups... The media server and the built in backup features leave a lot to desire, so I don't use it... This is a really cheap way to put storage on a home network, and it's reasonably fast to boot... The only potential pitfall is that sometimes the device implies a copy has completed successfully, only to later show no file or a truncated file. So I just double check before deleting the original file and no more frustration... They say you get what you paid for, and at these prices, I can live with the limitations...
customer_reviews.author: D. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Seems worthless
customer_reviews.text: 60 second took hours. Device failed to recognize either a portable hard drive or SD card. After a number of hours, the hard drive showed up...Q&A says something about the need to analyze. Lost connection quickly and took another couple of hours to connect. Never could figure out how to make a drive attached to the device visible to the PC. Tech support, only via email, could not seem to help. Had to return product as it sure seems worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Donbie

customer_reviews.title: Fits the description
customer_reviews.text: It fits the description in that it allows you to access your data over the internet ie cloud storage, but an option to allow local, via samba and/or uPnP, would have been nice and easily done by the manufacturer because it seems silly to have to relay your data through the internet when it is already sitting on a server on your own network. Pros: Somewhat easily access your data from the internet Cons: No local network access
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Good Update
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better product than the earlier versions. It does what it says it will do and is fairly easy to setup and use. Keep in mind, it is a big draw on your Internet Service and should slow down computer access and might affect uVerse TV display. I cannot say 100% for sure about the issues with uVerse but the problems stopped when I disconnected the Pogoplug. The problem was skipping and hanging. I am sure further testing would be necessary to determine actual affect.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Craig

customer_reviews.title: Own the cloud, only give access to those you trust
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an earlier version of this product. I keep my own cloud. Pictures from my phone back up automatically. Files from my laptop, back up automatically. Anywhere I am I can access them from the internet. Imagine all the pictures you take on your phone backed up by date. I have shown friends 8 year old pictures on my phone, taken with a DSLR, No phone has that much memory. This is hands down the best tech accessory I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: T. Adas

customer_reviews.title: hate reoccuring charges so let my account expire but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still not sure about the whole popoplug device...it's cheap enough for this little craddle but seemed expensive to pay $29,95 every year...hate reoccuring charges so let my account expire but I can still access it. I just have everything backed up to a 3TB device right here at my home (yes I know, what if there's a fire, well that's just the chance you take I guess)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came in a worn package and the product itself looked ...
customer_reviews.text: Came in a worn package and the product itself looked used with scuff marks on the outside. After looking at the product, it seems the item is also old technology wise.
customer_reviews.author: esteedel

customer_reviews.title: If you love to get your personal cloud service for cheap price
customer_reviews.text: If you love to get your personal cloud service for cheap price, this is the one for you. This device will change your portable or external hard drive into your own private cloud. You can access to this device anywhere in the world without leaving your computer on. I really love this item and will definitely recommend to someone.
customer_reviews.author: Edward K.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this device!!! Obviously Pogoplug changed their remote access software, so you can access files only on your computer and not on their device anymore. The first couple of days it would see the hard drive attached to the device, but since about the end of January the software on the computer and the mobile device only sees folders and files on the computer. Stay away. No wonder the device was sold cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Juergen Amling

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners who just want a little backup
customer_reviews.text: The overall concept of this device is cool however the transfer limitations of one file at a time and the inability to access the hard drives from your computer except through their software. The other concerning issue I have with this device is it requires Pogo to remain in business should they go under the device does not work. The software included is a little painful to use if you are a more advanced user
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M. Spelman

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this item came to me completely unusable. I tried everything short of breaking the warranty to get it to work. Thanks to Amazon's no problem return policy I was able to return it, but I wish I could have used it or something similar.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Luna

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware, mediocre software.
customer_reviews.text: The concept itself is great. The hardware is phenomenal. The software, however, is not so great. The Android app is pretty annoying and the browser interface only gives you the basics. You do have the ability to use your own file manager and have your storage show up as a network drive so long as you're running the Pogoplug Backup Companion (not compatible with Linux).
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Love it, when it works
customer_reviews.text: As the title says, I love my pogoplug when it works. Every once in a while the drive will stop appearing in Windows explorer. From what I have read online, this is an issue that has been around for some time. The solution is to unmount the drive, plug the drive into your PC, reboot the pogoplug, and plug everything back in. To make the process even more fun for me, I have two of these, one of them at work and one at home. I wish pogoplug would get around to fixing this KNOWN bug instead of dreaming up new ways to charge monthly fees.
customer_reviews.author: Darwyn C. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS solution
customer_reviews.text: Great device for a NAS storage solution. Great if you want to set up for backing up on your local network or to your own cloud storage solution. Works great out of the box, easy to setup. It is up and running in less than 3 minutes. You can decide how / who to share the files with. I really like this device!
customer_reviews.author: BioshockHalo

customer_reviews.title: an inexpensive alternative to a home NAS system
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the PoGoPlug as an inexpensive alternative to a home NAS system to serve several computers. It adequately meets this expectation. Access to home data storage and files is also available over the Internet from remote locations. File sharing is also possible w/ remote users whom you invite to share. PoGoPlug also offers add'l paid services, but I've found them to not be necessary at this time.
customer_reviews.author: gmstadler

customer_reviews.title: Great cloud
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. Having your cloud in your own house makes it a little safer. Also, you can add several hard disks so you are the one who decides what size of cloud you need. Accessing your files online or in mobile device is convenient, however, not all video or music formats reproduce directly from there, some you actually have to download before you ca reproduce.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Plex Server
customer_reviews.text: Got this device to use as a Plex Server for my Roku devices and it works great. Installed Arch Linux on a Sandisk 8GB low profile USB stick and bought a 32GB SD card to hold the movies along with an Airlink 101 USB Wifi adapter and was good to go. This device doesn't have the CPU power to transcode movies, but as long as the files are encoded properly as MP4/H264/AAC they play great on my Roku devices. Great inexpensive way to stream movies or MP3's without having to use a PC or laptop as the server.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Holliday

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Signed up for unlimited pogoplug cloud service to use with the device. Didn't work, even after: -- two weeks of back and forth with do-nothing support -- unanswered letter to the Chief Technical Officer (Brad Dietrich) -- unanswered letter to the VP of E-Commerce (Lisa Contoyannis) -- leaving two messages on HQ's message system (no one EVER answers the phone); no response
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product was almost worthless, it took me days to ...
customer_reviews.text: Product was almost worthless, it took me days to get it to read my Hard Drive. Once it read my Hard drive it would not allow me to access my account. I would avoid this and try a different product.
customer_reviews.author: piccilo72

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to use the USB 2.0 port, you have to remove the top cover. Good Luck on getting the cover off. I found it easier to just drop it on its edge on the floor and hope the cover pops off. Otherwise it works as advertised. If you intend to stream video, you need a relatively fast internet connection. If you're using ADSL you need at least 3MB (or better) upstream. I have had pretty good success with 3MB up and 16MB down. Don't be browsing or run an internet server on the same connection or you will mess up the upstream video unless you have a lot of UPSTREAM bandwidth.
customer_reviews.author: Reality Check

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't that great
customer_reviews.text: I ended up repurposing it as a web server, but stopped using it as pages tended to load very slowly and it was really heating up. I reverted it back to it's original state, and tried using it as it was intended, but even then it was burning up badly. File transfers were a bit slow, and some things had actually corrupted (good thing I was just testing it out with a usb!). I don't think I'd use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Accel

customer_reviews.title: waste of money...
customer_reviews.text: Please find some alternative than this useless thing... Doesn't recognize my drives...
customer_reviews.author: nitz

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! The set up was extremely easy. It probably took no more than 5 minutes to install the hardware and software. It works great too. I can access it from any where and it works perfectly for streaming video. Now I have full access to my shared files any where I go. I highly recommend this if you are looking to build your own cloud system.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ghaemi

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: works well if using the cloud or as a nas but the pogoplug pc feature has never worked for me. it is an additional software purchase anyway so after the trial I won't be buying it. they offered a deal for unlimited pogoplug cloud for $4.95 month with 5 free months. and nas feature has worked just fine for me. use it on my droid and work pc to access my files and no issues o far.
customer_reviews.author: William Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful "Time Capsule" for my Macs
customer_reviews.text: After following an online tutorial to get this thing booting Debian from a Sandisk Cruiser Fit USB and handing a 2TB external drive from one of the USB 3.0 ports, this device now service as a cheap and cheerful "Time Capsule" for my Macs.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisW

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Convoluted software solution. Slow device. Didn't recognize all my attached drives, but my laptop and desktop machines had no problem seeing them. There is no easy way to utilize this as a home NAS, such as with SAMBA shares or anything like that. Great idea, poor execution. I would not recommend this device to people.
customer_reviews.author: Travis B

customer_reviews.title: Too slow and I can't really justify running all that ...
customer_reviews.text: Too slow and I can't really justify running all that electricity. I ended up not using it. It sits in a box somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: jonknee

customer_reviews.title: Great item, mediocre service
customer_reviews.text: Hey everyone, I bought this best version awhile back. It did do somethings I wanted, but it relies on streaming over your internet at home, which means it is only as fast as your internet speed. My family has Highspeed DSL 6Mbps and it is able to handle a 2GB movie. Above that it won't work unless you have faster speed...
customer_reviews.author: J. Ives

customer_reviews.title: Underpowered CPU
customer_reviews.text: Although Pogoplug Series 4 is equipped with 1GbE, SATA and USB 3, at 800MHz the CPU is the bottleneck. It is too slow to be able to saturate any of the I/O ports. Peak read throughput I managed to pull from an SSD over GbE on the Pogoplug is around 56MB/s or ~450Mbps using Nginx. I only managed to get 20MB/s or 160Mbps using NFS. Many applications like SFTP will be much slower. YMMV.
customer_reviews.author: pikine

customer_reviews.title: USB 3 didnt work on my all of my HD ...
customer_reviews.text: USB 3 didnt work on my all of my HD, other services you get, you have to pay for them and u dont need to have this little device,, i would say,, dont wast your money on this, get HD with NAS,
customer_reviews.author: abdullah

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I know what I was ordering.. be sure you do. For what I needed it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Imaxinar DM

customer_reviews.title: The customer support is horrible (I placed a ticket just to have it closed ...
customer_reviews.text: The only way to access any of the shares is through their software. It was also described to have SSH capability, which it does not. The customer support is horrible (I placed a ticket just to have it closed immediately, referring me to their online support). The device runs extremely hot and access times for the drives are horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Moonglum95

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tiny little box. It makes sharing meia files across my network absolutely painless. The setup was a breeze and now I have a great place to store media files to use anywhere in the house. THe only drawback is that the software is updated very frequently and the software is a bit wonky.
customer_reviews.author: Dan W.

customer_reviews.title: It's a great device.
customer_reviews.text: You add an SD card in ext3 format, you install ipkg on it and then you can install anything you like, from bittorrent to samba and now can share files with windows, FTP network or whatever you want, without losing all the great features that provides pogoplug. I just recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny De Castro

customer_reviews.title: great way to create your own cloud
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, installed the software and was up and running in minutes. easy access to files on the go. can attach multiple storage devices. speed on the local network is very fast. it may not be the best option for trying to watch movies when you're on the road, but that's not what i was looking for... it meets all my needs and wants.
customer_reviews.author: Sinjintek

customer_reviews.title: Great little product
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for something like this for a long time to backup my home computer systems. It was a little misleading that in order to backup multiple computers, I would need to pay $29 a year. But it is worth it. The thing was so easy to set up and I love the fact that I can access my files from anywhere using any of my devices.
customer_reviews.author: J. Huggins

customer_reviews.title: Free service no longer free?
customer_reviews.text: Works great, can use to access from phone (Android) or PC from home or from anywhere with internet access. BIG downside is they are now charging an annual fee to use their service, whereas before this was free. Honestly I don't know if this is just for their "cloud" storage or for actual network access remotely. You can set it up with Linux as well and mount as a filesystem, but YMMV with implementation.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Great device and service
customer_reviews.text: Not much setup at all to do just need hard drive, sd card or usb to use as the storage. No problems setting up and works great to since your pictures from your phone to you house.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Got confused with the function
customer_reviews.text: It's good to have these for Cloud functionality. However, I thought this can be used as a NAS. It's basically a personal cloud storage if you're trying to find one.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo Joseph Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work reliably
customer_reviews.text: Really awful. Requires proprietary software to access what's on your drives. And that software is unreliable and buggy. For example, it will intermingle files from different computers, even when you tell it to store them separately. Also, it cannot seem to keep a reliable connection with either WD or Seagate external USB3 Drives.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Great hardware.  I'm not using the service
customer_reviews.text: I installed Debian on this and am using this as a small Linux server. No fan, so it is absolutely silent, and very very low power. I like it so much that I bought two. I'm running an asterisk server on one, and a file server on the other.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Not Ready for Prime Time
customer_reviews.text: Slow, even over a fiber connection. Buggy software. I will keep it just for file access in shallow directories. This thing really needs more CPU, Ram, or whatever. Locks up on IOS, Windows (Web Browser), and android. I should not be a beta tester for this company. Also, stop with the pop ups for other products!!!! If I wanted it, I would have bought it already. They appear to be selling web storage services with the guise of selling you this unit. Crap....any way you look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Spiess

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several like options, one tied to my router that was a flop (slowed the entire network down), one that was a all-in-one solution (burnt out two power supplies and a hard drive), but this allows you to expand your storage, provides off-site storage, and off-site access to the files important to you. Setup in less than 5min!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: Horrible customer support. Please don't buy this device. Password reset link doesn't work. After 15 days following up with Pogoplug customer support, they are not willing to help the customer. Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: This a great Option
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this as I was tired of cloud based back-up systems. Once you down load the software and get yourself a external hard drive it works great I have backed up key files and photos. I would recommend this to anyone it is very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Honest Review
customer_reviews.text: Functions appropriately however if internet goes down local access is denied. Great hardware with mediocre software. Pogoplugs customer service is the worst in any country that I've dealt with so far.
customer_reviews.author: john mcnabb

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I think I had higher expectations for this Pogoplug Series 4 than what it is actually capable of. I was hoping I could attach it standalone from my pc and simply hooked into my router and a USB drive, then be able to access my music through my laptop, iPad, or PS3. Unfortunately, and this may simply be my unfamiliarity with this new device, I can only access my files through the proprietary app from Pogoplug.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Vaught

customer_reviews.title: Supprtless.  Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Non existent support. When you contact them you get an automated response saying here is a link to our website. Unfortunately their site is 5 years out of date and useless. The of course close the ticket everytime..
customer_reviews.author: DrUnifex

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: The software component is kind of weak. The ability to modify the the firmware with SSH access is great. Can enable and run disk as local samba shared with a little dirty Linux programming. Over all impression of the box is a neat little package with ability to increase functionality for power users. I would buy another and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Purchased PogoPlug Series 4 on 2012. Today I wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased PogoPlug Series 4 on 2012. Today I wanted to use it as a local NAS without internet access for my Security cameras but this device did not suppose for local network. It is a pain. Buyers should be aware about this device. It is not a real NAS as i expected. Put it in trash anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NoWay

customer_reviews.title: It's a complete file server the size of a tape measure...
customer_reviews.text: I deliver commercial photography electronically. This device makes it a breeze because I can send my finished files to it directly out of the post processing software. My clients get both Web and publication sized files seconds after I finish. Sure, I could email them one or two at a time -- but this allows them to drag and drop the entire collection in one move.
customer_reviews.author: Digital RL

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: I like it cause it gives me access to all my files and pics I have attached to it. Now, it is not without saying isn't perfect by all means the I face could be better and more manageable. But for my purposes it works and does alright. You can add folders and move files around.
customer_reviews.author: MWJII

customer_reviews.title: Very good deal for the price if you want a small ...
customer_reviews.text: Very good deal for the price if you want a small nas type of device, personally I ended up putting linux on a flash drive and booting from it so I could install samba and other services.
customer_reviews.author: Angel D. Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Software changes to the app makes this unit unusable with ...
customer_reviews.text: Software changes to the app makes this unit unusable with mobile devices, the manufacturers service department told me this would not change. Once you have a problem with this product, your on your own.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up, and incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: My android phone, my wife's iphone, my tablet and my windows pc are all backing up automatically and wirelessly with minimum fuss. I love that I can get to all my photos from anywhere I've got an internet connection. No complaints from this moderately technology literate user.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smorol

customer_reviews.title: Installed ArchArm and set up as a NAS
customer_reviews.text: The original software on this device is very good and I can see it being super useful for a lot of people. I purchased it for setting up a Network Attached Storage device with a USB3 RAID array. The presence of USB3 ports was the clencher for this purchase (along with the price!!) though I've heard others have had trouble getting them to perform to the fullest. I haven't fully tested this myself, but even if there is an issue with speed on the ports, the device still works for my needs. Cheap (nigh disposable) backup solution and file server. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Micah Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: This could have have offered great features but the software is terrible and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not what I was hoping for! This could have have offered great features but the software is terrible and it is not worth trying to mod it.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Litwin

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Poorest of Poor software.... they call it NAS but 1. exFAT is not supported 2. Connected hard drive keeps vanishing in Mac 3. Zero support for Mac 4. USB3.0 external hard drive keeps going to sleep (inspire of doing the horrendous request from their support, "disable hard disk sleep") 5. No wake up on LAN Only thing that is good is the concept.... hopefully they should had over the software part to someone else. Even at $27 it is a waste of money and time, don't know how people bought this when it was $100+
customer_reviews.author: Rajesh Nagarajan

customer_reviews.title: Does what we had hoped it would do
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a way to backup our (2) iPhones, our (2) iPads, our desktop computer and our laptop computer all in one place - we have accomplished that with PogoPlug
customer_reviews.author: Marco and Tilly, NV

customer_reviews.title: ... to access my remote storage over the internet is great, but the backup software is a little "iffy"
customer_reviews.text: Being able to access my remote storage over the internet is great, but the backup software is a little "iffy". I like that I can set "Preferences" so that the remote drive appear as drives on my computer, but sometimes they disappear and I have to reboot in order to get them to appear again. After I installed the Android app on my tablet, I started having some system problems which stopped after I uninstalled the Pogoplug app.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Good, solid, easy backup
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, solid backup for the average consumer. I recommend this product for anyone who needs to backup an iPhone, iPad, computer or Mac. The best thing about it is that it organizes pics by month / year so it was nice to go thru them and have it readily available to me anytime I want on my iPhone!
customer_reviews.author: MMG

customer_reviews.title: A simple home cloud device
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother to upload online servers. Just plug your drives to this tiny gadget for secure file sharing and backup. Install Pogoplug version 5.2.0 for (P:\) local drive.
customer_reviews.author: burentogunter

customer_reviews.title: ordered 2, returned them both. One was bricked ...
customer_reviews.text: ordered 2, returned them both. One was bricked out of the box, other had intermittent failure of he power supply.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's cool, you can plug USB devices and create your own cloud. You do have to go through their website. They do try to upgrade you to cloud based backup, but it's not that intrusive. Overall I am very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup, Very Slow
customer_reviews.text: Bought several of these for use and experimentation. Using the Pogoplug service, they are function, very easy to set up, and ponderously slow. I wish they could work a little faster when used as a local drive.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for home use only, and it ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for home use only, and it fits my purpose well. I have kept all my movies on the drive and connected to pogoplug and installed plex media server. using chromecast to play the movies on my tv.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loses Drives
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 drives connected to my Pogoplug. Both drop off regularly and only turning everything off and on multiple times gets them reconnected. Great idea, poor execution in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Techie Chris

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing makes a great cloud backup for our ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing makes a great cloud backup for our Iphones and Ipads. Pogoplug setup is relatively easy but you have to make sure you are saving to the hard drive and not the Pogoplug clound they try to sell you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it was not intended for
customer_reviews.text: I've installed Archlinux on mine and using it to host a web site and discussion board on an 8G flash drive. Works great for that. I'll short it one star because I'm really not rating what it was intended for.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Gordon

customer_reviews.title: not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: worked for about 3 days and then died. i doubt this is ready for prime time as a product. The software is great and it sets up easily - get the Buffalo Cloudstor instead! Same great software, and much more robust design.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff from San Jose

customer_reviews.title: For around twenty bucks, you can not beat this ...
customer_reviews.text: For around twenty bucks, you can not beat this for a low-end NAS. It's got 2xUSB3 and 1xSATA, plus 1xGigE... and it comes in under 10 watts. You can run Debian on it.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: didn't work
customer_reviews.text: flashing yellow light. have pretty simple setup: windows 7, netgear router, Comcast internet all default setups should have been plug and play. returned!
customer_reviews.author: DylisTN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little device. It replaced a broken base for a Seagate remote access drive.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I bought an Amazon Warehouse Deal version. It couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought an Amazon Warehouse Deal version. It couldn't read any USB devices, although I could see it on the network.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Best product for cloud version
customer_reviews.text: Until now, this is best product i ever had it. Basically all my external hard drive are attached to it. Now i can create offline folder on my laptop and sync with my external hard drive and sync with any changes i make, so it works like Box.com offline folder. I have android app and i can access my storage under cloud any time and anywhere. If anyone need assistance with this product please contact me and i will make their set up easy.
customer_reviews.author: Kaushal Mehta

product_meta.title: Pogoplug Series 4 Backup Device
product_meta.description:
Pogoplug Series 4 is the easiest way to share and stream your files, photos, music and movies while on the road. Simply add storage and access all of your files through the internet. Pogoplug makes sharing massive files or folders easy and secure. You can send large files without uploading or attaching. Pogoplug Series 4 is fast and easy to setup, just add an SD card, external hard drive, flash drive or e-sata drive. Pogoplug comes with free mobile apps that are available for iPad and Android. Requires Windows XP/7, Apple OS 10.6.6 and above. Compatible web browsers are Microsoft Internet Explorer 8/9, Mozilla Firefox 5, Apple Safari 5 for Mac, Google Chrome 12. Also works with Xbox360 and Playstation 3.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


AT A GLANCE







HOW IT WORKS
feature_bullets: Continuous, centralized backup of all of your computers (Windows or Mac) and iPhone, iPad or Android devices
Backup continues even when you take your computers or devices away from your home or office
Keep your files safely at home but access them from anywhere
60-second setup never worry about backing up again
No storage limits and no additional fees when using your own external hard drive
Includes 2 USB 3.0, 1 USB, 1 SD Card Slot, and 1 USM/SATA Slot

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars503 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
